article: My senior year of high school was very busy. If I wasn't studying or worrying about _ , I was taking part in many activities after class or attempting to make my plans for _ . As the senior year began to slow down, I got a _ ob working at a local coffee shop. I had expected that the job would be _ , but there are _ when I was angry at the human race as a whole, simply because I couldn't seem to _ anyone. There was always too much sugar, too little ice, or not enough milk. However, I _ working at this coffee shop. One day, one of my _ customers came in, looking depressed and defeated. I asked what the _ was and if I could help, but the customer wouldn't say any details. He just said that he felt like lying on the bed, _ the sheets up over his head, and staying there for a few years. I knew exactly _ he felt. Before he left, I handed him a bag with his coffee. He looked at me _ because he hadn't ordered anything but the coffee. He opened the bag and saw that I had given him his favorite cookies. "It's on me." I told him. The next day that customer came again. Instead of ordering anything, he _ me a pink rose and a thank-you note saying that not too many people took the time to care about _ and that he was _ there were still people like me in the world. As time went on, I came across many _ customers. But anytime I felt _ , I thought of that little _ . Then I would smile, hold my head up high, clear my _ and ask politely, "How can I help you?"
